results.title: So far, so good
results.creator_credit: Joel Hagan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A growth spurt sent Joel Hagan into the arena of sports. Finding out he was naturally good at Australian rules, Joel has travelled around Australia, playing football and, later, rugby. Joel’s coaches taught him to be quick off the mark and not to wait for the ball, to go out and get it. These words have inspired Joel, not only in sports but in all aspects of his life and have given him the ambition to pursue a career in journalism in the future.

results.title: My "perfect" family
results.creator_credit: Ebonie Sadler-Small, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: While Ebonie Sadler-Small grew up with her grandmother, she attributes her entire family to the inspiring youth leader she is today. Ebonie feels that in not having a conventional family, she has gained an non-judgemental, adventurous and optimistic outlook on life. With her family and friends, Ebonie has been encouraged and supported and she feels this has given her the strength and confidence to achieve in life.

results.title: Three sisters and three ukuleles
results.creator_credit: T'Kido Titasey, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: T’Kido Titasey dedicates this story to his grandmother. Born a Torres Strait Islander, she never received a formal education but was taught about survival. After World War II, she set up a ukulele band with her two sisters. It became popular and The Mill Sisters travelled around the world and landed a recording deal. Gran’s resourcefulness and eagerness to try new things took her and her sisters on an amazing adventure and has been an immense inspiration to T’Kido.

results.title: Ron Magliozzi and Jenny He interview: 'Tim Burton: The Exhibition'

video_links.name: Ron Magliozzi and Jenny He interview: 'Tim Burton: The Exhibition'

results.brief_description: Jenny He (Curatorial Assistant, Department of Film) and Ron Magliozzi (Assistant Curator, Department of Film) are co-organizers of the Tim Burton exhibition, from MoMa (The Museum of Modern Art) in New York. Here they are interviewed by Kate Warren, ACMI’s Assistant Curator, about their work on ‘Tim Burton: The Exhibition’. They take us through the process, from inception, through to collaborating with Tim Burton, of Burton’s work and the curatorial process. As well as viewing Tim Burton’s work from an artistic perspective, we also gain insight into the art of the curator and curatorial perspective.

results.title: Our trip to Sydney
results.creator_credit: Bryce O'Neill-Baker, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Bryce O’Neill-Baker tells of the time when he was asked if he wanted to go to Sydney for a short trip. The next day, he joined a bus with family members and others from his community to visit Sydney for the weekend. As well as the normal sightseeing, he also got to experience the NAIDOC festival and warmly shares the effect this time had on his family.

results.title: This is me : foundation for young Australians (July 2009) : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Six young Indigenous Australians look back and reflect on the things, events and people that have inspired, encouraged and, ultimately, shaped them into the youth leaders they have become. While telling different stories, they all have some common themes, of family, connection to their land and culture and spirituality. The stories brim with optimism and uplift and inspire in much the same way that these young people were inspired by the stories of their ancestors.

group_works.title: Spirit, dance and connection = Spirit, dance & connection
group_works.creator_credit: Haryne Uta, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Spirit, dance and connection = Spirit, dance & connection
results.creator_credit: Haryne Uta, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Dancing is a way of life, culture and part of our identity. Haryne Uta, a young Torres Strait Islander, started dancing from a very young age. He tells of his journey to not taking it very seriously to realising, under the guidance of his elders, how crucial dancing is to Haryne’s spiritual awakening. The stories of the dance awoke in Haryne a sense of pride and connection to the spiritual world, people and the land.
results.title_for_label: Spirit, dance and connection = Spirit, dance & connection

results.title: Cate Blanchett: Screen Worlds Spotlight interview

video_links.name: Cate Blanchett: Screen Worlds Spotlight interview

results.brief_description: An interview with actor Cate Blanchett for Screen Worlds at ACMI. Cate Blanchett is an actor who has multiple awards including Golden Globe and Academy awards, and is well known for her roles in films such as “Elizabeth”, “Carol” and “I’m Not There”.

results.title: Sue Smith and John Alsop : Screen Worlds Spotlight interview

video_links.name: Sue Smith and John Alsop : Screen Worlds Spotlight interview

results.brief_description: An interview with screenwriters Sue Smith and John Alsop for Screen Worlds at ACMI. Sue Smith and John Alsop are screenwriters and playwrights who have collaborated on productions such as “My Brother Jack”, “Brides of Christ”, “Bordertown” and “The Leaving of Liverpool”.
